head.title: Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. - Page #20

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #20 of 32 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Umfreville, Edward. Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0030

div.p: to a Grassy pt on Rt – pass'd a deep bay on Rt & a rocky pt & a bay on Lt[.] Encamp[d.] (The River de lac Seul so far has a very flattering appearance being in many places near a mile wide, with an Easy currt all the way & pleast shores, & is a very fine inland River, its Co after leaving the large island mention'd before is Et & our Guide says runs down to one of the Hudson's Bay Settlemts. The Rapid pass'd in it to day is pass'd by the Line in gowing agt the Current.)

July 15 Thursday. From the pt of Grass on the Rt WbS1m. in a spacious openg to a rocky pt on Rt pass'd an Id on each side – turn'd ye pt & went Wt to a rocky pt on Lt ¾, leaving a large bay & Is on Rt – turn'd ye pt & went WSW1m. to a pt on Rt – pass'd an opening like a river on Rt – (this opening afterwds turns into a large bay, in which the French People sometimes pass to lac Seul, to avoid ye Port. but our Guide says it is a round abt way) & high rocky points on Lt then WbS2m. pass'd 2 Is & 1 bay on Rt & a grassy opening like a Swamp at the begining of the Co on Lt – then turn'd a pt on Wt Left & went WSW4m. in a clear wide Channel to a grassy pt on Rt pass'd a bay & 1 Isld on Lt – turn'd ye pt & went NWbW½ to a stony pt deep bay & 2 Is on Lt – NW¼ to a grassy pt on Rt – then in a bay NW1½ to a narrow Channl wild rice on each side, went in it abt 3m. (meadow land on each side) always keeping the Rt hand channel, to an opening which appears between a few willows to a small lac[,] this is a Port. & call'd Port. la Prairie 220yds over a fine meadow, not having 1 stick in the way – then in the lac abt ¾m. along the Shore on Rt – then turn'd down the 1st opening on same side, passing close to an Id on Lt – then across the lac No2m. a deep bay on Lt a lesser one on Rt – then turn'd on Rt & went NbE1m. from a pt of Stones to a narrow Chanl like the former with wild rice on each side, went to ye end ¾m. when it opens wide – then ¾ to 1st pt on Rt – then across ye lac No to a pt on Rt being the entrance of a broad Channel, like a River, went in it abt 1m. to a rock in the Channel, when it opens into a small lac, cross'd it 1m. to a pt on Rt – then another small lac cross'd it NNE¾ to a narrow Channel, with high Grass on each side, went to the end of it 4m. to the beginning of lac Seul, in wch to 1st pt on Lt ¼m. – across a bay on Lt to the pt of an Id ½ – from wch pt which is rocky, cross'd over to a long Id on the Rt & coasted along it abt 7m. crossing a bay on Lt (in this Co which is Wt pass'd a sandy pt which has around stone on it call'd Roche de Diable, this stone is reverenc'd by the Inds who have deposited sevl things as presents to the Old Gentn)[,] passing the pt which is abt 1m. from Roche de Diable went WNW2½ to a pt an excel[len]t Fishing [p]lace on Rt a bay on Rt spacious lac on Lt[.] (In this Co pass'd by an old Settlemt o[f] Mr Lyons on the Rt – when we were stopt by rain for the 3d time this day. Pierre Bonneau parted from us this morning in Co with the Inds met yesty[.] On the 1st entrance into lac Seul a long openg appears in view & goes No[.] Our Guide informs me that all the Inds who Trade at Albany Fort, pass by here, that it is no more than 3 days paddling to Henly House & 5 to Albany Ft & that Mr Lyons made 36 packs one year at this Settlemt[.])
16 Friday. From the end of last Co yesterday, Travers'd WNW1½m to a rocky pt on Lt[,] here ye lac opens spacious to the Lt – from the pt Wt 2½ to an opening like a

in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
